// Inside your AsyncTask's onPostExecute method
@Override
protected void onPostExecute(List<String> list) {
    int oldCount = adapter.getCount();
    adapter.clear();
    adapter.addAll(list);
    adapter.notifyDataSetChanged();
    if (listview.getLastVisiblePosition() == oldCount - 1) {
        listview.setSelection(adapter.getCount() - 1);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: After the AsyncTask finishes execution, the onPostExecute method is called. Here, we first get the old count of messages in the adapter. Then we clear the adapter and add all the new messages from the list. After that, we notify the adapter that the data has changed. If the last visible message in the ListView was the last message in the old list, we set the ListView's selection to the last message in the new list. This way, the ListView will automatically scroll to the new messages, but only if the user was already at the end of the list.
